translated: from the water onto the bank,
but now I will not go back to living with you,

original: Alametehi ambehi,🔽jambūhi panasehi ca;🔽Yāni pāraṁ samuddassa,
analyzed: alam etehi ambehi  jambūhi panasehi ca  yāni pāram samuddassa
translated: Enough of these mangoes,🔽and these rose-apples and breadfruit;🔽I prefer the fig tree

original: varaṁ mayhaṁ udumbaro.🔽Yo ca uppatitaṁ atthaṁ,🔽na khippamanubujjhati;
analyzed: varam mayham udumbaraḥ  yaḥ ca uppatitam attha  na khippam anubujjhati
translated: on the other side of the ocean.🔽One who does not quickly understand🔽an opportunity that has arisen
is followed by the power of the enemy,

analyzed: yaḥ ca uppatitam attha  khippam eva nibodhati
translated: But one who quickly understands🔽an opportunity that has arisen
is freed from the prison of the enemy,
and later he does not regret it.”
The Monkey Birth Story is the second.
